channel.title: cata-list
channel.description: Useful lists of some of the best info, media, tools, and quotes for those who seek to understand and improve this world.

item.title: Divers Haul 200lb of Trash From Lake Tahoe in a Day
item.description: Scuba team launches six-month effort that has already turned up fishing rods, tires and cans

item.title: 'Scientists' [Finally] Want a Serious Investigation Into the Origins of the Coronavirus
item.description: Scientists in several countries are calling for a serious investigation into the beginnings of SARS-CoV-2, the novel coronavirus that gave rise to the covid-19 pandemic. In an open letter released Thursday, the group says that there are still too many unanswered questions about how the pandemic star…

item.title: The Pentagon Is Tracking US Citizens Without a Warrant, Senator Says
item.description: The Pentagon may be using commercial data to track Americans without due legal process, according to a letter from Senator Ron Wyden..

item.title: Study Finds Alarming Levels of 'Forever Chemicals' in US Mothers' Breast Milk
item.description: Toxic chemicals known as PFAS found in all 50 samples tested at levels nearly 2,000 times what is considered safe in drinking water

item.title: Chemical Giants Hid Dangers of 'Forever Chemicals' in Food Packaging
item.description: The chemicals, called 6:2 FTOH, are now linked to a range of serious health issues, and Americans are still being exposed to them

item.title: Solar Pushback: How US Power Firms Try to Make People Pay for Going Green
item.description: In states such as Kansas, energy companies are seeking to impose financial charges on people who install rooftop solar arrays

item.title: AOC's Attack on Yang's Meaningless Israel Statement Shows Her Role: Protect Dem Leaders
item.description: Real power over U.S. policy toward Israel and Gaza rests with Biden, Harris, Pelosi, Schumer, Blinken -- not Yang. But AOC's function is to shield them from leftist anger.

item.title: Neural Implant Lets Paralyzed Person Type by Imagining Writing
item.description: A paralyzed individual hit 90 characters per minute, 99% accuracy.

item.title: Better Than Holograms: 3D-Animated Starships Can Be Viewed From Any Angle
item.description: Unlike holograms, the optical trap display produces images viewable from all angles.

item.title: US Millionaire CEOs Saw 29% Pay Raise While Workers' Pay Fell, Report Finds
item.description: Workers saw 2% decrease as companies gave leaders bonuses and forgiving performance benchmarks amid pandemic

item.title: Will Science Survive Politics?
item.description: Whether something is politically convenient or not doesn't affect its truth

item.title: Reporters Once Challenged the Spy State. Now, They're Agents of It
item.description: News companies are pioneering a new brand of vigilante reporting, partnering with the spy agencies they once oversaw

item.title: Air Pollution Linked to Increased Mental Health Outpatient Visits
item.description: More pollution in the air could be linked to higher rates of mental health service utilization, researchers at the Yale School of Public Health found in a new

item.title: Tribalism Has Come to the West
item.description: Hostile and polarised, today's America reminds me of my Somalian clan

item.title: The Pentagon Inches Toward Letting AI Control Weapons
item.description: Drills involving swarms of drones raise questions about whether machines could outperform a human operator in complex scenarios.

item.title: Bombshell Dossier Indicates China Has Been 'Preparing' for Bio-Warfare
item.description: A recently uncovered bombshell dossier suggests Chinese scientists have been 'preparing' for a Third World War fought with 'biological and genetic weapons – including coronavirus,' according to Sky News host Alan Jones. 'The paper by Chinese scientists describes these biological weapons as the core…

item.title: Antony Blinken Continues to Lecture the World on Values His Administration Aggressively Violates
item.description: How can you feign anger over others' attacks on a free press when you imprison Assange as punishment for his vital revelations about U.S. officials?

item.title: Portland Man Recovering From Beating After Armed Standoff Amid Protest
item.description: Portland Police are trying to sort out exactly what happened that ended up sending Joseph Hall, 53, to the hospital.

item.title: Publishing Is Now a Left-Wing Bubble
item.description: A letter filled with hysterical analogies indicates an industry in crisis

item.title: China's Carbon Pollution Now Surpasses All Developed Countries Combined
item.description: As China's coal-reliant economy has boomed, so, too, have its emissions.

item.title: Biggest ISPs Paid for 8.5 Million Fake FCC Comments Opposing Net Neutrality
item.description: ISP-funded astroturfing used millions of real names and faked consent records.

item.title: Natural Gas Is Now More Deadly Than Coal in 19 States
item.description: Unhealthy air pollution generally brings to mind coal-fired plants spewing black soot. But that image may quickly be outdated. A study published on Wednesday in found that natural gas air pollution caused more deaths in 19 states than burning coal.

item.title: SpaceX Successfully Lands a Starship Test Flight
item.description: Given that it's meant to be the basis for a lunar lander, landing it is good.

item.title: Signal Said Facebook Shut Down Its Advertising Account After the Privacy-Focused Messaging App Tried to Buy Instagram Ads Showing How the Social Media Giant Collects Data
item.description: CEO Moxie Marlinspike tweeted an example that shows how occupation, location, dietary preferences, and fitness interests can be used to target ads.

item.title: The Tactics Police Are Using to Prevent Bystander Video
item.description: Kian Kelley-Chung was wearing a black T-shirt with the logo of his documentary and art collective on the day last summer when he found himself filming the Washington, DC, police during a protest. It was August 13, 2020, and Kelley-Chung had been recording Black Lives Matter demonstrations in the cit…

item.title: Be It Resolved: The Mainstream Media Is Dying, and That's OK. Matt Taibbi Debates Ben Bradlee, Jr.
item.description: In Canada's 'Munk Debates' series, a civil discussion about the future of media

item.title: Corporate News Outlets Again 'Confirm' the Same False Story, While Many Refuse to Correct It
item.description: Journalists with major outlets know they spread a false, retracted story about the FBI and Giuliani but refuse to remove it, because their real job is spreading disinformation.

item.title: EPA to Eliminate Climate 'Super Pollutants' From Refrigerators, Air Conditioners
item.description: Hydrofluorocarbons saved the ozone layer, but they're killing the climate.

item.title: Havana Syndrome: NSA Officer's Case Hints at Microwave Attacks Since 90s
item.description: When Mike Beck developed a rare form of Parkinson's US intelligence concluded he was the victim of a hi-tech weapon

item.title: When Will Activists (And the Media) Get Honest About Police Shootings?
item.description: Minutes before Derek Chauvin was convicted on all three counts of murder and manslaughter, Ma'Khia Bryant, a black teenage girl in Columbus, Ohio, was shot dead by police. Almost immediately, enrag…

item.title: The Left Continues to Destroy Itself and Others With Evidence-Free Destruction of Reputations
item.description: Equating accusations with proven fact is reckless and repressive. It is also standard behavior in liberal politics, whereby they ruin lives without a second thought.

item.title: Biden Erased Decades of Historic Crimes in His Speech to Congress
item.description: Biden's claim that the Capitol Riot was the 'worst attack on our democracy since the Civil War' is ahistorical garbage.

item.title: The Journal of Controversial Ideas Is Here
item.description: The long-awaited first issue of Journal of Controversial Ideas (JCI), which allows academics of all disciplines to publish peer-reviewed research anonymously, has just been released. In an editoria…

item.title: Court Rules That EPA's Delay 'Exposed a Generation of American Children' to Brain-Damaging Pesticide Chlorpyrifos
item.description: The ruling represents a stark repudiation of the Trump EPA's refusal to ban chlorpyrifos.

item.title: Satellites Show World's Glaciers Melting Faster Than Ever
item.description: Glaciers are melting faster, losing 31% more snow and ice per year than they did 15 years earlier, according to three-dimensional satellite measurements of all the world's mountain glaciers. Scientists blame human-caused climate change. Using 20 years of recently declassified satellite data, scienti…

item.title: Empire Politician: A Half-Century of Joe Biden's Stances on War, Militarism, and the CIA
item.description: The new president's paper trail reveals a man who has often betrayed his own bedrock principles.

item.title: Experian API Exposed Credit Scores of Most Americans
item.description: Big-three consumer credit bureau Experian just fixed a weakness with a partner website that let anyone look up the credit score of tens of millions of Americans just by supplying their name and mailing address, KrebsOnSecurity has learned. Experian says…

item.title: Nestlé Threatened With Cease-and-Desist Over Alleged Illegal Water Use
item.description: Company's claims hinge on how much water early-1900s rail cars carried.

item.title: High-Bandwidth Wireless BCI Demonstrated in Humans for First Time
item.description: BrainGate device complements Neuralink's successful test of wireless BCI in monkey.

item.title: You Can't Cure Racism
item.description: Efforts to medicalise a social problem could be fatal

item.title: CNN's New 'Reporter,' Natasha Bertrand, Is a Deranged Conspiracy Theorist and Scandal-Plagued CIA Propagandist
item.description: In the U.S. corporate media, the surest way to advance is to loyally spread lies and deceit from the U.S. security state. Bertrand is just the latest example.

item.title: 25,000 Barrels of Suspected DDT Found Off the California Coast
item.description: A known DDT dump site off the coast of Southern California is considerably larger than suspected, in a discovery that's sounding the alarm bells. Research by the Scripps Institution of Oceanography shows thousands of potentially toxic barrels on the seafloor.

item.title: ACLU Again Cowardly Abstains From an Online Censorship Controversy: This Time Over BLM
item.description: The once-principled group issues P.R.-scripted excuses or engages in obfuscation to avoid taking stances that would offend its liberal donor base.

item.title: Interview: Glenn Greenwald, on 'Securing Democracy,' Twitter, and the Media Business
item.description: 'I tend to have a pretty polarizing effect on the discourse,' says the author, in a free-ranging talk about Bolsonaro's Brazil, his time at The Intercept, and critics who accuse him of being pro-Trump

item.title: Grade Inflation Is Ruining Education
item.description: 'When people lose the connection between their actions and their consequences, they lose their hold on reality and the further this goes the more it looks like madness.' ~ Robert Greene A recent st…

item.title: The Slander Industry
item.description: Who makes money from destroying reputations online?

item.title: Climate Crisis Has Shifted the Earth's Axis, Study Shows
item.description: Massive melting of glaciers has tilted the planet's rotation, showing the impact of human activities

item.title: Pharmaceutical Industry Dispatches Army of Lobbyists to Block Generic Covid-19 Vaccines
item.description: New lobbying disclosures show over 100 drug lobbyists working to defeat the IP waiver request at the WTO.

item.title: The Heroic Congressional Fight to Save the Rich
item.description: A handful of Democrats want to hold up a $2 trillion infrastructure bill to save a choice tax deduction for the wealthy, not that you'll hear it described that way

item.title: NASA Generates Oxygen on Mars, Setting Stage for Crewed Missions
item.description: A device on the Perseverance rover produced roughly 5 grams of oxygen, a potentially huge leap for humanity and our aspirations on Mars.

item.title: Space Junk Is Our New Tragedy of the Commons
item.description: Unless countries overcome their differences and regulate the use of satellites, we’re all headed for trouble.

item.title: Fukushima: Japan Announces It Will Dump Contaminated Water Into Sea
item.description: Environmental groups and neighbours condemn plan to release more than 1m tonnes of contaminated water in two years' time

item.title: Wall Street's Cooked Books Fueled the Financial Crisis in 2008. It's Happening Again.
item.description: This time, the issue is not a bubble in the housing market, but apparent widespread inflation of the value of commercial businesses, on which loans are based.

item.title: Psychedelics Are Transforming the Way We Understand Depression and Its Treatment
item.description: Psychiatry has long failed to explain depression. Our research into psilocybin suggests a new approach, says researcher Robin Carhart-Harris

item.title: The Media Lied Repeatedly About Officer Brian Sicknick's Death. and They Just Got Caught.
item.description: Just as with the Russia Bounty debacle, they will never acknowledge what they did. Their audience wants to be lied to for partisan gain and emotional pleasure.

item.title: More J&J Troubles: Vaccine Manufacturing Halted and More Possible Clot Cases
item.description: CDC advisory committee will meet Friday to decide the fate of the troubled vaccine.

item.title: How Anarchists Captured Portland
item.description: Left-wing rioters are burning the city to the ground — while the police do nothing

item.title: NASA's Ingenuity Mars Helicopter Succeeds in Historic First Flight
item.description: Monday, NASA's Ingenuity Mars Helicopter became the first aircraft in history to make a powered, controlled flight on another planet. The Ingenuity team at the agency's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Southern California confirmed the flight succeeded after receiving data from the helicopter via NASA's…

item.title: Journalists, Learning They Spread a CIA Fraud About Russia, Instantly Embrace a New One
item.description: The most significant Trump-era alliance is between corporate outlets and security state agencies, whose evidence-free claims they unquestioningly disseminate.

item.title: The U.S. Could Have Left Afghanistan Years Ago, Sparing Many Lives
item.description: America will depart without having accomplished its goals and with more Afghan suffering ahead.

item.title: Chemical Industry Lobbyist in Trump EPA Suppressed Evidence of Cancer Risk
item.description: The EPA inspector general found that Bill Wehrum, who ran the agency's office of Air and Radiation, buried data about cancer risks from ethylene oxide pollution.

item.title: Why Spy Agencies Say the Future Is Bleak
item.description: Climate change, technology, disease and financial crises will pose big challenges for the world, an intelligence report concludes.

item.title: Australia Finds Google Misled Users Over Data Collection
item.description: The ACCC said it is seeking declarations, pecuniary penalties, publication orders and compliance orders but did not specify any amount.

item.title: The Nation's Corn Belt Has Lost a Third of Its Topsoil
item.description: Researchers used satellite imaging and surface soil color to find out how much of the nutrient-rich earth has eroded away

item.title: Mice Fed Fast Food Get Noticeably Stupider, Scientists Warn
item.description: Diet seems to have a bigger impact on neurological health than scientists thought.

item.title: Credit Card Companies Are Tracking Shoppers Like Never Before: Inside the Next Phase of Surveillance Capitalism
item.description: In the battle between data brokers and privacy advocates, the latest front is the credit card.

item.title: Humans Have Destroyed 97% of Earth's Ecosystems
item.description: Only 3% of land on Earth still qualifies as 'ecologically intact,' with undisturbed habitats and healthy populations of its original animal species, grim new research shows.

item.title: Google Earth Is Now a 3D Time Machine
item.description: Google puts 20 petabytes of historical satellite data into the Google Earth globe.

item.title: Anti-Colonialism's Bad History
item.description: Prevailing academic theories of race relations hold that wealth and power differences between groups of people arose from social, economic, and legal systems created to benefit one group of people …

item.title: Psilocybin: Magic Mushroom Compound 'Promising' for Depression
item.description: A study of 59 people compared the drug with a conventional antidepressant.

item.title: Navy Acknowledges Weird Footage of Unidentified Objects Flying Around Its Ships Is Real
item.description: The Pentagon has officially verified that night-vision video circulating of unidentified, triangular aerial craft swarming around the Navy's Arleigh Burke-class destroyer USS Russell in 2019 is real, as first reported last week by Mystery Wire.

item.title: Can You Teach Children to Be Anti-Racist?
item.description: In 1935, Richard Clarke Cabot, a professor of clinical medicine and social ethics at Harvard University, began one of the first randomized controlled experiments in the field of social science. In …

item.title: I Refuse to Stand by While My Students Are Indoctrinated
item.description: Children are afraid to challenge the repressive ideology that rules our school. That's why I am.

item.title: The War Against Money-Laundering Is Being Lost
item.description: The global system for financial crime is hugely expensive and largely ineffective | Finance & economics

item.title: U.S. Pauses J&J COVID-19 Vaccine Over Rare Blood Clots
item.description: U.S. federal health agencies on Tuesday recommended pausing the use of Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine for at least a few days after six women under 50 given the shot developed rare blood clots, dealing a fresh setback to efforts to tackle the pandemic.

item.title: Big Corporations Now Deploying Woke Ideology the Way Intelligence Agencies Do: As a Disguise
item.description: By draping itself in the finery of political activism, the corporatist class consolidates political power, corrupts democracy and distracts from its real functions.

item.title: The Covid Dissidents Taking on China
item.description: Beijing's science stooges are being unmasked by an international team of online sleuths

item.title: The Global Business of Professional Trolling
item.description: Troll farms are a booming business in the developing world.

item.title: Data Brokers Are a Threat to Democracy
item.description: Unless the federal government steps up, the unchecked middlemen of surveillance capitalism will continue to harm our civil rights and national security.

item.title: Plastic Is Falling From the Sky. But Where's It Coming From?
item.description: At any given time, 1,100 tons of microplastic are floating over the western US. New modeling shows the surprising sources of the nefarious pollutant.

item.title: SpaceX's Falcon Heavy Rocket to Deliver an Astrobotic Lander and NASA Water-Hunting Rover to the Moon in 2023
item.description: SpaceX is set to send a payload to the Moon in 2023, using its larger (and infrequently used) Falcon Heavy launch vehicle. The mission will fly a lander built by space startup Astrobotic, which itself will be carrying NASA's VIPER, or Volatiles Investigating Polar Exploration Rover (this is t…

item.title: 100 Million More IoT Devices Are Exposed—and They Won't Be the Last
item.description: The Name:Wreck flaws in TCP/IP are the latest in a series of vulnerabilities with global implications.

item.title: New Mexico Becomes Latest State to Legalize Marijuana, a Rebuttal to America's 'Failed War on Drugs'
item.description: Gov. Michelle Lujan-Grisham signed legislation on Monday that legalizes recreational cannabis and erases many past criminal convictions.

item.title: Interview: Noam Chomsky
item.description: On Biden vs. Trump, his new book, and why manufacturing consent 'is much easier now.'

item.title: Black Lives Matter, So Refund the Police
item.description: During the summer of 2020, following the deaths of George Floyd and Breonna Taylor, it was easier to count how many cities didn't have Black Lives Matter (BLM) protests than to count the ones that …

item.description: On February 8th, 2021, the Students of Color Liberation Front at the University of Michigan made a series of anti-racist demands, including a call to 'Decolonize the University of Michigan's pedago…

item.title: Ecological Impacts of Solar Geoengineering Are Highly Uncertain
item.description: New research describes the unknowns in our knowledge of solar geoengineering.

item.description: Sandra Sellers, an adjunct professor at Georgetown University's Law Center, was forced to resign because she was caught on video saying to her colleague and co-teacher David Batson: 'I hate t…

item.title: Facebook Had Years to Fix the Flaw That Leaked 500M Users' Data
item.description: Software makers can't catch every bug every time, but Facebook had ample warning about the privacy problems with its 'contact import' feature.

item.title: More Than Half of Older Millennials With Student Debt Say Their Loans Weren't Worth It
item.description: Even as the oldest millennials turn 40 this year and approach middle age, student debt continues to follow them.

item.title: A Wireless Brain-Computer Interface Has Been Successfully Tested on Humans for the First Time
item.description: Scientists say the Braingate device is the first high-bandwidth wireless brain-computer interface (BCI) to be demonstrated on humans.

item.title: The Two Faces of Joe Biden
item.description: The press is building an image of a 'radical' progressive hero, while reality looks a lot like the same corporate Democrat

item.title: How Gadgets Could Unlock the Potential of Lucid Dreaming
item.description: Recent experiments show we can learn in our dreams. What else could we do with the right technology?

item.title: Neuralink's Brain-Computer Interface Demo Shows a Monkey Playing Pong
item.description: Elon Musk's Neuralink is building brain-computer interfaces, like the one that allows this monkey to control a game of Pong with its thoughts.

item.title: We're Entombing the Earth in an Impenetrable Shell of Dead Satellites
item.description: A recent study suggests that there is now nowhere on Earth free from the light pollution produced by overhead debris and satellites. Researchers expect that problem to only get worse as mega-constellations of internet-beaming mini-satellites, like SpaceX's Starlink program, take off.

item.title: Japan Says Sorry, but It Has to Dump This Radioactive Water Into the Ocean
item.description: 'What to do with the [treated] water is a task that the government can no longer put off without setting a policy.'

item.title: Facebook Does Not Plan to Notify Half-Billion Users Affected by Data Leak
item.description: Facebook Inc did not notify the more than 530 million users whose details were obtained through the misuse of a feature before 2019 and recently made public in a database, and does not currently have plans to do so, a company spokesman said on Wednesday.

item.title: Nobody Will Win the Culture Wars
item.description: Today's 'cancel culture' debates are designed to fail

item.title: Meet the Censored: The U.S. Right to Know Foundation
item.description: A nonprofit that investigates Genetically Modified Organisms and the origins of Covid-19 is the latest to see its traffic plunge after a search engine update

item.title: The Scientists Who Say the Lab-Leak Hypothesis for SARS-CoV-2 Shouldn't Be Ruled Out
item.description: For many scientists, challenging the idea that SARS-CoV-2 has natural origins is seen as career suicide. But some say the idea it came from the Wuhan lab should still be discussed.
